title: Device
content:
It's helpful for end users to understand the role of devices in the SACM model, and how they relate to the traditional UDM classification.

  • In the Universal Data Model (UDM) Specification, a device configuration item is a node with one or more node elements.
  • In Service Management:
    • Each system element contains zero or more devices.
    • Every device supports a system element or a service component.
    • A device is a type of configuration item.

Examples:

  • A computer that's visible on a network
  • A firewall that's not visible on a network
  • Servers, desktop computers, switches, and routers

Example:

Store (category)

     Book Store (service definition)

          Buy new book (actual service)

                ....

          Buy used book (actual service)

                Orders application (service component)

                     ....

                Catalog application (service component)

                     JBoss application server (system element)

                          NYDC server 1 (node)

                          NYDC server 2 (node)

                      IIS web server (system element)

                          NYDC server 3 (node)

                Shipment application (service component)

                     ....
